articles.title: Cryptocurrency mutual funds have arrived: Here are the key things to know
articles.author: James Royal
articles.summary: ProShares' mutual fund affiliate ProFunds launched the Ether ProFund (ETHFX) in late February, following the debut of the Bitcoin ProFund in mid-2021. Both funds aim to track the price performance of their underlying cryptocurrencies. They are the first mutual funds to track these cryptos. They invest in cryptocurrencies through futures contracts, a kind of financial derivative that can deliver higher (or lower) returns than the crypto coins themselves. They have net expense ratios of 1.16 percent and 1.46 percent. Spot Bitcoin ETFs own actual bitcoins and spot Ethereum ETFs have actual ether coins. They charge fees of 0.19 percent to 0.25 percent.

Exchanges operating in India must register with the Financial Intelligence Unit of the Union Ministry of Finance, follow strict Know-Your-Customer (KYC) norms, and report suspicious transactions. articles.title: Former Orr man pleads guilty in crypto case
articles.author: David Colburn
articles.summary: Joshua Armbrust, 44, pleaded guilty in federal court to a felony computer fraud charge tied to a cryptocurrency mining scheme targeting his former employer. He accessed the Amazon Web Services (AWS) accounts of Minnetonka-based payment processing company Digital River between December 2020 and May 2021. He used the company's resources without authorization to mine Etherum, a type of cryptocurrency. He racked up more than $45,000 in cloud computing charges to Digital River and liquidated at least $7,000 into a Wells Fargo bank account. He was arrested in St. Paul on Nov. 1, 2024.
